properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong low pressure system which is giving blizzard conditions to areas along the Hudson Bay coast is giving very strong north winds but lesser amounts of snow to Baker Lake this morning. Similar conditions will persist today with north winds of 70 gusting 90 km/h and around 5 cm of snow. Conditions should start to gradually improve overnight or Tuesday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-29T06:24:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-28T14:25:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4250835349.2019
Area: Baker Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A strong low pressure system east of Churchill is giving blizzard conditions with northeast winds of 70 gusting 90 km/h to Chesterfield Inlet, Rankin Inlet and Whale Cove this morning. Similar conditions will persist through today, tonight, and most of Tuesday. Total snowfall accumulations could reach 30 cm in some areas, along with visibilities frequently near or less than 400 metres. Gradual improvement is expected Tuesday night when the system starts to weaken. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-29T06:30:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-28T14:31:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3310009059.2019
Area: Rankin Region including Whale Cove, Chesterfield Inlet
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-29T00:23:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-28T14:30:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2968840867.2019
Area: Arviat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Strong winds, heavy snow and blowing snow today and tonight improving on Tuesday. A low pressure system tracking across Hudson Bay is bringing strong northerly winds and heavy snow to the Churchill area. North winds will reach 70 gusting 90 km/h early this morning but diminish somewhat this afternoon and early this evening. Visibilities will be greatly reduced at times due to heavy snow and blowing snow, especially this morning. Winds may reintensify again overnight night before diminishing again Tuesday afternoon. Total snowfall accumulations are expected to be in the 15 to 20 cm range by Tuesday evening. Conditions will start to improve Tuesday as the system slowly weakens. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-29T01:31:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-28T09:32:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1977897470.2019
Area: Churchill
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A strong low pressure system east of Churchill will continue to give snow and gusty northeast winds to Arviat today and tonight, with a further 10 cm likely. Winds are no longer expected to reach the warning threshold of 70 gusting 90 km/h though, and will remain closer to 50 gusting 70 km/h. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-29T06:35:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-28T14:36:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3150006396.2019
Area: Arviat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Cold northwest winds blowing off Lake Winnipeg are generating snow squalls near Berens River, with localized accumulations up to 15 cm possible. The snow squalls should begin weakening this morning. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-28T16:59:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-28T09:39:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1094819427.2019
Area: Berens River, Bloodvein
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected. A strong low pressure system will bring damaging winds, with gusts near 100 km/h, to Paulatuk, Sachs Harbour, and Ulukhaktok later today. These winds will create blizzard conditions in Paulatuk beginning near noon today. Similar conditions will develop in Sachs Harbour and Ulukhaktok late this afternoon or early this evening. These blizzard conditions will improve overnight tonight into Tuesday morning as the wind weakens. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-10-29T08:27:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-10-28T16:28:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2747718547.2019
Area: Sachs Harbour, Ulukhaktok, Paulatuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada
